job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Create a profile and receive smart job recommendations based on your liked jobs.
   Create profile

   As INDG's software branch, Grip simplifies content production by combining CGI, rule-based generative AI, and post-production into an easy-to-use content generator that transforms master ad creatives into infinite variations for clients that include The Coca-Cola Company, L'Oréal, LVMH, and Beiersdorf.

   As our new Head of Pipeline & Rendering Engineering you will manage the pipeline team, as well as work in close collaboration with the rest of our R&D Team, our Artists, and the Grip Software Development Team. You and the team will be responsible to define, architect, and develop the core of our production and automation pipeline - the actual heart of Grip's capability to create and deliver product images at unprecedented scale and quality.

   You will be spearheading our Graphics development projects, mentoring colleagues, and providing first-hand technical and automated solutions for our artists and the ecosystem behind Grip. Together with our Development and Operations teams, you will also ensure the pipeline is well set up and working at maximum efficiency.

   Automation is in your heart, and you aren't afraid to get your hands dirty with developing some code. Creating an automated and state-of-the-art pipeline for breathtaking visual results with the pipeline team is your number one goal. You'll also deeply understand and give guidance around the inner aspects of Computer Graphics, Rendering, Modelling, Compositing, Workflows, and further aspects of 3D content production at scale. It is your passion to combine your knowledge in these areas with automation driven by code, inside and outside of 3D applications.

What will you be doing?

     * In close collaboration with our CTO and different technical and artistic teams, define, develop, and run the next version of our rendering technology (both from a creative tooling & pipeline perspective and our end-user software).
     * Guiding and making pipeline technology choices and defining the future architecture of our technology platform.
     * Close collaboration with our Grip development and technical teams to identify shared (technical) approaches.
     * Collaborating with our artists to develop the tools and automation they need.
     * Build, test, & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline.
     * Document and possibly train artists to use the pipeline, pick up enhancements, and implement directly.
job_details.full_text:
Lead Pipeline Engineer/Head of Pipeline

Create a profile and receive smart job recommendations based on your liked jobs.
   Create profile

   As INDG's software branch, Grip simplifies content production by combining CGI, rule-based generative AI, and post-production into an easy-to-use content generator that transforms master ad creatives into infinite variations for clients that include The Coca-Cola Company, L'Oréal, LVMH, and Beiersdorf.

   As our new Head of Pipeline & Rendering Engineering you will manage the pipeline team, as well as work in close collaboration with the rest of our R&D Team, our Artists, and the Grip Software Development Team. You and the team will be responsible to define, architect, and develop the core of our production and automation pipeline - the actual heart of Grip's capability to create and deliver product images at unprecedented scale and quality.

   You will be spearheading our Graphics development projects, mentoring colleagues, and providing first-hand technical and automated solutions for our artists and the ecosystem behind Grip. Together with our Development and Operations teams, you will also ensure the pipeline is well set up and working at maximum efficiency.

   Automation is in your heart, and you aren't afraid to get your hands dirty with developing some code. Creating an automated and state-of-the-art pipeline for breathtaking visual results with the pipeline team is your number one goal. You'll also deeply understand and give guidance around the inner aspects of Computer Graphics, Rendering, Modelling, Compositing, Workflows, and further aspects of 3D content production at scale. It is your passion to combine your knowledge in these areas with automation driven by code, inside and outside of 3D applications.

What will you be doing?

     * In close collaboration with our CTO and different technical and artistic teams, define, develop, and run the next version of our rendering technology (both from a creative tooling & pipeline perspective and our end-user software).
     * Guiding and making pipeline technology choices and defining the future architecture of our technology platform.
     * Close collaboration with our Grip development and technical teams to identify shared (technical) approaches.
     * Collaborating with our artists to develop the tools and automation they need.
     * Build, test, & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline.
     * Document and possibly train artists to use the pipeline, pick up enhancements, and implement directly.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on managing and developing a production pipeline for CGI and generative AI in the context of content creation. While it mentions 'generative AI' and 'automation driven by code', it lacks specific details about core AI/ML modeling tasks (like training, fine-tuning, or deploying predictive models) or advanced LLM/generative model development. The emphasis is on pipeline engineering, graphics development, and automation for artists, rather than on building or directly working with AI models themselves. This aligns more with a traditional software engineering or pipeline engineering role enhanced by AI tools, rather than a dedicated AI Engineer role as defined in the coding book. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category due to its primary focus not being on AI/ML model development or deployment, but rather on the infrastructure and tools supporting content creation.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves 'developing the core of our production and automation pipeline', 'spearheading our Graphics development projects', 'developing some code', and 'build, test, & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline'. This indicates significant software development responsibilities, particularly in building and maintaining the pipeline infrastructure.
job_tasks.phrase: develop the core of our production and automation pipeline

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'developing some code' directly points to hands-on coding activities as part of the role's responsibilities.
The responsibility to 'Build, test, & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline' clearly falls under software development lifecycle management.
job_tasks.phrase: Build, test, & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline

job_tasks.justification: The role requires defining and architecting the technology platform, which involves understanding the business needs for content creation at scale and translating them into technical strategies.
job_tasks.phrase: defining the future architecture of our technology platform

job_tasks.justification: Collaborating with the CTO and artistic teams to define and run the next version of rendering technology implies understanding business goals and translating them into technical requirements for creative tooling and end-user software.
job_tasks.phrase: define, develop, and run the next version of our rendering technology

job_tasks.justification: The responsibility to 'ensure the pipeline is well set up and working at maximum efficiency' and to 'build, test, & deploy frequent changes and updates to the pipeline' touches upon operational aspects of maintaining and deploying the pipeline, which is akin to MLOps for production systems.
job_tasks.phrase: ensure the pipeline is well set up and working at maximum efficiency

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'rule-based generative AI' and 'automation driven by code', and understanding 'Modelling' in the context of 3D content production. While not explicitly about ML model training, it refers to generative techniques and modeling within the graphics domain.

The phrase 'automation driven by code, inside and outside of 3D applications' suggests the application of code to automate processes, which can include aspects of modeling or generative tasks within the graphics pipeline.
Understanding 'Modelling' is listed as a key aspect of 3D content production that the candidate needs to guide.

soft_skills.phrase: you aren't afraid to get your hands dirty
work in close collaboration with the rest of our R&D Team, our Artists, and the Grip Software Development Team
